description:
Four men are assigned to the prison: Juugo, a man who attempted to break out of prison and ended up extending his jail time; Uno, a man who likes to gamble with women; Rokku, a man who likes to get into fights; and Nico, a man who likes anime.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Delinquents
tags.description: Features characters with a notorious image and attitude, sometimes referred to as "yankees".

tags.name: Prison
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a prison.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Cute Boys Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around male characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Femboy
tags.description: Features a boy who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of girls.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Bisexual
tags.description: Features a character who is romantically or sexually attracted to people of more than one sex or gender.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Ninja
tags.description: Prominently features Japanese warriors traditionally trained in espionage, sabotage and assasination.

tags.name: Tanned Skin
tags.description: Prominently features characters with tanned skin.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

tags.name: Makeup
tags.description: Centers around the makeup industry.

tags.name: Unrequited Love
tags.description: One or more characters are experiencing an unrequited love that may or may not be reciprocated.

tags.name: Disability
tags.description: A work that features one or more characters with a physical, mental, cognitive, or developmental condition that impairs, interferes with, or limits the person's ability to engage in certain tasks or actions.

tags.name: Poker
tags.description: Centers around the game of poker or its variations.

tags.name: Karuta
tags.description: Centers around the game of karuta.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/3684225924)

Originating from [Gonzo](https://anilist.co/studio/3/).
**Mochizuki Mariko** is a Japanese script/screenwriter and series composer.

**[Website](http://iris-in.com/)**

**Birthplace:** Fukuoka Prefecture, Japan

**Irie Shingo** is a Japanese script/screenwriter and series composer.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/3684225924)

Originating from [Gonzo](https://anilist.co/studio/3/).
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/広田光毅)

[Profile](http://zynchro.jp/talent/kakihara.html) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/charisma.tetsuya.days/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/tetsuya-kakihara/)

Commonly referred to as Kakkii by fans, Kakihara is a voice actor and a singer. As the latter, he is a member of Kiramune (music label) and represents the color of green. He was inspired to become a voice actor by [Yuuji Ueda](https://anilist.co/staff/95058/Yuuji-Ueda)'s performance in the Tokimeki Memorial dating sim game, and moved from Germany to Japan at age 18 to pursue his dream.

Kakihara speaks Japanese, English and German.

**Non-anime roles:**
- Wanderer - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Lloyd Bannings - The Legend of Heroes Series (VG)
-Asaba Harumasa - Zenless Zone Zero (VG)
Animator and character designer affiliated with A-1 Pictures.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kkeennjjii___F)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/daikiprt)
Fumio Kaneko is a producer.

__Height:__ 174 cm

[Profile (HeroQ)](https://heroq.com/members/seki_tomokazu/) | [Profile (Atomic Monkey)](http://www.atomicmonkey.jp/jp/archives/talent/sekitomokazu) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/seki0908) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/sekitomokazu/)

A Japanese voice actor, stage actor, narrator and singer affiliated with talent agency [Atomic Monkey](http://www.atomicmonkey.jp/jp/), having previously worked under [Haikyou](https://haikyo.co.jp/). He's also a chair member of creative production team HeroQ, which he joined in 1994.

__Non-anime voice roles:__
- Miguel O'Hara - *Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse* (2023 Film; JP dub)
- Toad - *The Super Mario Bros. Movie* (2023 Film; JP dub)
- Marc Spector/Moon Knight, Steven Grant/Mr. Knight, Jake Lockley - *Moon Knight* (2022 TV; JP dub)
- Siegfried Kaslana - Honkai Impact 3rd (VG)

[Twitter](https://x.com/Aaron__Dismuke)

Aaron is an American voice actor who works for anime series of Funimation Entertainment.  He started voice acting when he was nine years old as the voice of Hiro Sohma and the young Akito Sohma in Fruits Basket. He was only twelve years old when he voiced the role of Alphonse Elric in Fullmetal Alchemist, and is a cousin of voice actor and director Justin Cook. Aaron was one of few child voice actors in the voice acting field.  Due to his voice maturing, he was replaced by Maxey Whitehead for his role of Alphonse Elric in Fullmetal Alchemist: Brotherhood, but makes a cameo as the voice of the young Van Hohenheim, Edward and Alphonse's father.

[Twitter](https://x.com/Aaron__Dismuke)

Aaron is an American voice actor who works for anime series of Funimation Entertainment.  He started voice acting when he was nine years old as the voice of Hiro Sohma and the young Akito Sohma in Fruits Basket. He was only twelve years old when he voiced the role of Alphonse Elric in Fullmetal Alchemist, and is a cousin of voice actor and director Justin Cook. Aaron was one of few child voice actors in the voice acting field.  Due to his voice maturing, he was replaced by Maxey Whitehead for his role of Alphonse Elric in Fullmetal Alchemist: Brotherhood, but makes a cameo as the voice of the young Van Hohenheim, Edward and Alphonse's father.

**Height:** 173 cm (5'8")
**Agency:** Himawari Theatre Group

[Profile](https://profile.himawari.net/view/1542) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/U_Yutopan) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Y%C5%ABto_Uemura)
_Note: Not to be confused with the [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/185932/)._
The Super Ball consists of two members: Yogo Sasaki and Riki Yoshida. The two of them met at an audition on 2013, and have been active at the live houses and street.

Originating from [Satelight](https://anilist.co/studio/41/Satelight).

_Note: Not to be confused with the other [Animator](https://anilist.co/staff/269426/Akiho-Matsui)._

__Cousin:__ [Aaron Dismuke](https://anilist.co/staff/95254/Aaron-Dismuke)

__Justin Ryan Cook__ is an American voice actor, producer, line producer, ADR director and enginner who works for FUNimation.
